src:
டெல்லியில் போலீசார்-வழக்கறிஞர்கள் இடையே ஏற்பட்ட மோதல் துப்பாக்கிச்சூடு
டெல்லி தீஸ் ஹசாரி நீதிமன்ற வளாகத்தில் போலீசார் - வழக்கறிஞர்கள் இடையே ஏற்பட்ட மோதலில் துப்பாக்கிச்சூடு நடைபெற்றிருப்பது பரபரப்பை ஏற்படுத்தியுள்ளது.

02 Nov 2019

புதுடெல்லிடெல்லியில் போலீசார் மற்றும் வழக்கறிஞர்களுக்கு இடையே டெல்லி தீஸ் ஹசாரி நீதிமன்ற வளாகத்தில் மோதல் ஏற்பட்டுள்ளது. இந்த மோதலின் போது துப்பாக்கிச்சூடும் நடந்ததால் அங்கு பரபரப்பு நிலவுகிறது.போலீஸ் வாகனம் தீவைத்து எரிக்கப்பட்டுள்ளது. போலீசார் சுட்டதில் வழக்கறிஞர் ஒருவர் காயமடைந்தார். இதனையடுத்து அவர் மீட்கப்பட்டு மருத்துவமனையில் சிகிச்சைக்காக அனுமதிக்கப்பட்டுள்ளார்.
text:
Israel attacks Gaza after rockets launched towards Israel
Hamas began last year with the weekly demonstrations against a blockade of Israel and Egypt that takes 12 years
02 Nov 2019, 00:06 by AP
CITY OF GAZA, Gaza Strip (AP) - Israeli planes began attacking militant sites in the Gaza Strip on Saturday morning, hours after Palestinian militiamen launched 10 rockets into southern Israel, ending a month of tranquility on the volatile border.
In an initial statement, the Israeli army said its warplanes "began attacking terrorist targets in Gaza" while shelling was heard on the other side of the coastal enclave.




The Palestinian press reported that several air strikes were against training sites and outposts affiliated with Hamas, the Islamic militia group that controls Gaza, and other groups.
Three Palestinians had moderate to severe injuries caused by splinters from one of the attacks, according to Gaza health officials. Witnesses at Nasser Hospital, in the southern city of Khan Younis, said the three were sitting in an orchard adjacent to one of the posts that was attacked.
On Friday afternoon, 10 rockets were launched south of Israel in two rounds with minutes apart, causing damage to a house.
There were no reports of deaths. Israeli police said shrapnel damaged a house in the southern town of Sderot and videos show a car near the structure with broken windows.
The Israeli army said seven rockets were launched in the first incident and that the Iron Dome missile defense system intercepted them. Minutes later, three rockets were launched and only one was intercepted.
No Palestinian group claimed responsibility for the attack.
Israel blames Hamas leaders in Gaza for any attack from the enclave. The militia group says it remains committed to maintaining an unofficial truce, but other groups that include Iran-backed Islamic Jihad and smaller Salafist factions sometimes act independently of Hamas.
Hours earlier that same Friday, Gaza health officials reported that several Palestinians were shot dead during protests along the border fence between Gaza and Israel.
Hamas began last year with the weekly demonstrations against a blockade of Israel and Egypt that takes 12 years.
International mediators, including Egypt, Qatar and the United Nations, oversee the ceasefire between Hamas and Israel to decrease the intensity of the protests and pacify the border area in exchange for humanitarian projects in the coastal enclave. Hamas blames Israel for not complying with the agreement by delaying the implementation of the pact.






Gaza Strip
